comments.text: Thanks for the video Doc.
comments.author: @douglasbarnhart3324

comments.text: What would you recommend for rock garden beds that have weed barrier ? i hate using dangerous chemicals because I dont want cancer and they tend to also kill some of the plants that are in the area.
comments.author: @RayWilliamJohansen

comments.text: Sure wish Doc would say what volume his light application is for the liquid pre-emergent.    I purchased Dimension 2EW liquid and the application rate is .38 to .73 fluid ounces per acre.  I would think a light application would be anything under 1/2 the maximum rate, but what is Doc 's light rate that makes it effective for a southern Bermuda lawn?  It's pricey so I don't want to waste it which would happen either too light (not effective) or too heavy, (wasting product).
comments.author: @sandmandave2008

comments.text: Since the south had that winter blast 2 weeks ago, we've been 65 - 80 degrees here near Fort Worth since then, and that's going to continue for the next 15 days, which is not normal, so I've been wondering if I need to get the Barricade down this week or wait til the end of the month. I already have new weeds coming up. 🤔
comments.author: @dianes2300

comments.text: If it’s mostly weeds, why not spray and kill that backyard off with glyphosate first and then overseed a couple days later?
comments.author: @davidmorrison7424

comments.text: Hi Doc.  Feb 8th I put down Barricade because I kept getting alerts from GreenCast that my average soil temperature was 55 and 56 degrees.  I am in Grovetown Ga, do you think I jumped the gun on this?  I do have Dimension to put down later.
comments.author: @KeishaR-s8z

comments.text: Doc, let's just hope that we do not see another Feb/March like we had in 2023.  Warmed-up'd then a cold snap, rinsed and repeat.
comments.author: @jimmymiller4732

comments.text: Wont the pre-emergent stop lawn seeds from germinating as well? If you put it down too close to seeding the seeds won’t grow. This is the problem I have. I don’t know how to time it since it’s so close to seeding.
comments.author: @carlm4619

comments.text: I really like your content! But, stick to the subject. Pre-Emergent is what this video should be about. I highly respect your opinion and I want to improve my lawn.
